alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 10:37AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. At 24.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. River Road in Tarboro is underwater and flooding begins on east Wilson and St David Streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 22.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Tar River Tarboro 19.0 17.6 Sat 10 am ES 20.1 21.3 22.2 20.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
